title: forge fmt: Additional formatting features

body: Open to all of these! Would recommend doing 1 PR per, and thinking about "what does the config look like" for these, as Maple has a pretty unique formatting style which some may not want to use.

Yup agree a separate PR for each. In terms of config had the following suggestion for each:

1. top_level_spacing: bool
2. ignore_section_headers: bool
3. assertion_alignment: bool (could be further extended with different options later)
4. assignment_alignment: bool
5. tuple_spacing: bool
6. state_variable_alignment: bool
7. import_alignment: {false, "left_justify_from"} (I can foresee options being added here so being specific would help)

The defaults for these would all be set false or the equivalent. Agree some of these items are unique so would be an opt-in approach.

@0xfarhaan my recommendation is to delay 2. since #3786 refactors comment handling. otherwise, these requests fall into two categories - spacing and alignment. spacing most likely would have to be handled on-site - embedding logic into visiting tuples and function calls. as for alignment, there could be a nice abstracted helper method for doing this, dunno yet ðŸ’­
Hey all, going to make individual issues to discuss these and provide diff examples so we can prioritize and revive this awesome future feature!
